events.title: Consecration of Westminster Abbey
events.description: Westminster Abbey in London was consecrated, becoming a significant religious and cultural landmark.
events.significance: Westminster Abbey has been the site of numerous royal ceremonies, including coronations and weddings, and remains a symbol of British heritage.

events.title: The UK Reform Act 1832 receives Royal Assent
events.description: The UK Reform Act 1832, also known as the Great Reform Act, was enacted, reforming the electoral system of England and Wales.
events.significance: This act was a key step in the democratic development of the UK, broadening the electorate and eliminating many 'rotten boroughs'.

events.title: First Commercial Movie Screening
events.description: The first commercial public screening of movies took place at the Grand Café in Paris by the Lumière brothers.
events.significance: This event marks the birth of the cinema industry, revolutionizing entertainment worldwide.

events.title: Spanish–American War ends with Treaty of Paris
events.description: The Treaty of Paris was signed, ending the Spanish–American War and transferring Puerto Rico, Guam, and the Philippines to the United States.
events.significance: This treaty marked the emergence of the United States as a global colonial power.

events.title: Nixon's 'Silent Majority' Speech
events.description: President Richard Nixon delivered a televised speech appealing to the 'silent majority' to support his policies in Vietnam.
events.significance: This speech was significant in shaping public opinion on the Vietnam War during a turbulent period in US history.
